discoveredAssets: localhost:3000 - FastAPI profile editing application (uvicorn) - Port 3000, HTTP GET/POST
localhost:3000/docs - Swagger UI API documentation interface - Port 3000, HTTP GET
localhost:3000/redoc - ReDoc API documentation interface - Port 3000, HTTP GET
localhost:3000/openapi.json - OpenAPI 3.1.0 specification (JSON) - Port 3000, HTTP GET
localhost:3000/ (GET) - Profile form display (HTML) - Returns 200 OK
localhost:3000/ (POST) - Profile update endpoint with file upload (multipart/form-data) - Returns 200 OK, 422 validation error
localhost:3000/ping - Health check endpoint - Returns {"ping":"pong"} - 200 OK
localhost:3000/hint - Hint/directory listing page (HTML) - Returns 200 OK with empty file list
localhost:3000/docs/oauth2-redirect - OAuth2 redirect handler - Port 3000, HTTP GET

targets.objective: Test POST endpoint for: file upload vulnerabilities (SVG XXE injection, XSS via SVG payload, SSRF via SVG external entities), input validation bypass on required fields (name, surname, address), injection attacks (command injection, SQL injection, NoSQL injection), path traversal, SSRF, and stored XSS in form persistence
targets.rationale: CRITICAL - This is the primary functionality endpoint accepting file uploads and user input. SVG file uploads present significant security risks including XXE, XSS, and SSRF. No file type validation or content inspection appears to be in place based on API spec

targets.objective: Test GET endpoint for: reflected XSS via query parameters, information disclosure through form values persistence, CSRF vulnerabilities on form submission, authentication/session management bypass
targets.rationale: HIGH - Form displays user input values in HTML, potential stored/reflected XSS if values not properly sanitized. Query parameters accepted (tested with ?id=1)

targets.objective: Analyze API specification for: information disclosure (endpoint enumeration), schema details for exploitation, validation rule bypass opportunities, potential for API manipulation via specification knowledge
targets.rationale: HIGH - Publicly accessible API specification reveals complete application structure, data models, and validation rules. Can be used to craft malicious requests

targets.objective: Test API documentation interface for: XSS vulnerabilities, CSRF attacks via documentation, potential for endpoint manipulation through interactive testing interface
targets.rationale: MEDIUM - Interactive API documentation can be exploited to test/execute actual requests. May have client-side vulnerabilities

targets.objective: Test hint endpoint for: information disclosure, directory listing exposure, path traversal via the 'directory listing' functionality, potential backend file access
targets.rationale: MEDIUM - Endpoint mentions 'directory listing' and shows empty file list placeholder. May be exploitable for information disclosure or file access

targets.objective: Test ping endpoint for: denial of service via request amplification, time-based blind injection, response manipulation, header injection
targets.rationale: LOW-MEDIUM - Health check endpoint may be exploitable for ReDoS, injection attacks, or used in amplification attacks

targets.target: http://localhost:3000 - Form Input Fields (name, surname, address)
targets.objective: Test form input validation for: XSS (reflected and stored), SQL injection, NoSQL injection, command injection, SSTI (Server-Side Template Injection), HTML injection, buffer overflow, special character handling, length validation bypass
targets.rationale: HIGH - Three required text input fields with no visible validation in API spec. Fields may be stored or reflected in responses. Test comprehensive payload sets for injection vulnerabilities

targets.objective: Test all HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH, OPTIONS, HEAD, TRACE) on all endpoints to discover: method-based vulnerabilities, CORS misconfigurations, hidden functionality via alternative HTTP methods, HTTP method override vulnerabilities
targets.rationale: MEDIUM - API restricts methods but potential for bypass. OPTIONS method may leak information. Test for HTTP smuggling and method confusion

targets.objective: Test for: missing authentication on all endpoints, authorization bypass, privilege escalation if multi-user system exists, session management flaws, JWT/token vulnerabilities if used, default credentials
targets.rationale: CRITICAL - No authentication detected on any endpoint during reconnaissance. Determine if this is intentional or a security gap. Test all endpoints for auth requirements

targets.objective: Test SVG upload specifically for: XML External Entity (XXE) injection attacks, SVG-based XSS payloads, XXE SSRF attacks, billion laughs DoS, entity expansion attacks, SVG animation/script tag injection, SSRF via SVG image URLs, file storage location enumeration, file access control
targets.rationale: CRITICAL - Application specifically accepts SVG format. SVG is XML-based and notorious for XXE vulnerabilities. Test comprehensive XXE and XSS payloads targeting SVG format

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] File upload endpoint (POST /) accepts SVG files with no apparent input validation or file type checking - potential XXE, XSS, and SSRF vector
[CRITICAL] No authentication or authorization detected on any endpoint - all API endpoints are publicly accessible without credentials
[HIGH] API documentation fully exposed (Swagger UI, ReDoc, OpenAPI JSON) - reveals complete application structure and data models
[HIGH] SVG image upload endpoint present with no file type restrictions visible - major security concern for XXE and XSS attacks
[MEDIUM] Form field values persisted in HTML response - potential stored XSS if not properly sanitized
[MEDIUM] /hint endpoint mentions 'directory listing' - may enable file access or information disclosure
[MEDIUM] HTTP method enforcement present but limited (only GET/POST allowed on most endpoints)
[LOW] Application built with FastAPI/Python - uvicorn web framework detected
[INFORMATIONAL] Application provides three endpoints: profile GET/POST, ping health check, and hint endpoint
[INFORMATIONAL] Bootstrap 4.3.1 CSS framework used for UI - no known vulnerabilities in current version
